issue.title: Build SplitSync (Expense Sharing App) - With Dependency Tracking
issue.body:
Build SplitSync, a modern expense sharing application similar to Splitwise.

## Tech Stack
- Next.js 16.1.4 with App Router
- TypeScript 5.9.3
- Drizzle ORM with SQLite
- Socket.io for real-time updates
- Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui for UI
- Playwright for E2E testing

## Core Features
1. User authentication and session management
2. Group creation and management (users can create expense-sharing groups)
3. Expense tracking (who paid, split type, amount, date, description, category)
4. Multiple split methods (equal, exact amounts, percentages, shares)
5. Balance calculations (who owes whom)
6. Settlement tracking (partial and full settlements)
7. Real-time updates via WebSocket
8. Expense activity feed

## Requirements
- Complete database schema with all tables
- Authentication with secure password hashing
- RESTful API for all operations
- Responsive UI with modern design
- Real-time updates using Socket.io
- E2E tests with Playwright

The implementation should be production-ready with proper error handling, validation, and edge cases covered.

ems.task: Project Setup - Initialize Next.js project with all configuration files including package.json, tsconfig.json, next.config.js, tailwind.config.ts, .github/workflows/ci.yml, .env.example, .gitignore, and shared type definitions. NO implementation code.

workers.task: Create root-level project configuration files for Next.js 16.1.4 with TypeScript, including package.json with all dependencies (Next.js, TypeScript, Drizzle ORM, Socket.io, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, Playwright), tsconfig.json with strict settings, next.config.js, tailwind.config.ts, .gitignore for Node.js/Next.js, .github/workflows/ci.yml for CI/CD pipeline, Dockerfile for containerization, .env.example with environment variable templates, and README.md with project documentation

analysisSummary: Build SplitSync, a full-stack expense sharing application with Next.js 16, Drizzle ORM, and Socket.io. Includes user authentication, group expense management, multiple split methods, balance calculations, settlement tracking, and real-time updates.

pendingEMs.task: Authentication System - Implement secure user authentication with password hashing, session management, login/register forms, auth middleware, and session utilities using Next.js App Router patterns.
Group Management API - Build RESTful API endpoints for creating and managing expense-sharing groups, adding/removing members, and group permissions.
Expense Management API - Build RESTful API endpoints for creating, updating, deleting expenses with support for multiple split types (equal, exact, percentages, shares).
Balance & Settlement API - Implement balance calculation engine, debt simplification algorithm, settlement tracking API, and partial/full payment handling.
UI Components Library - Build reusable UI components using shadcn/ui including forms, cards, tables, modals, expense lists, balance displays, and navigation components.
Pages & Views - Implement main application pages including dashboard, group detail view, expense creation/editing, settlement pages, and user profile using Next.js App Router.
Real-time Features - Implement Socket.io WebSocket server for real-time expense updates, balance changes, activity feed, and live notifications.
E2E Testing Suite - Write comprehensive Playwright E2E tests covering authentication, group creation, expense management with all split types, settlements, and real-time updates.
